reviews.text: The Morse message queue intermittently stalls during local Daylight Saving Time (DST) transitions, specifically when clocks advance from 02:00 to 03:00.
This occurs because local timestamping introduces a non-monotonic jump, causing messages with timestamps during the skipped hour to appear out of order or invalid.
As a result, the queue halts processing until manual intervention or timeout recovery, disrupting time-critical telemetry operations.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes queue halting until intervention or timeout.

reviews.text:
**Fix**  
All message timestamps will be converted to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) at the point of queue insertion, eliminating reliance on system-local time.
reviews.reason_text: Enforces conversion of timestamps to UTC for queue insertion.

reviews.text: A DST flag will be added to the message header for diagnostic transparency, allowing downstream systems to detect whether the message originated during a DST transition.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes a constraint to detect DST transitions in headers.

reviews.text: This ensures temporal consistency across all regions and avoids ambiguity during clock changes.
reviews.reason_text: Ensures temporal consistency across regions to prevent ambiguity.

reviews.text:
**Test**  
Implement a simulation that toggles the system clock across a DST boundary (02:00 â†’ 03:00) in a controlled environment.

reviews.reason_text: Sets the behavior of enqueuing at specific timestamps.

reviews.text: Verify that messages are timestamped in UTC without interruption, and the queue processes all entries in chronological order.
reviews.reason_text: Enforces correct timestamping and processing order.

reviews.text: Confirm that maximum observed delay does not exceed one second during the transition.
